title: Irish Tea Brack (Tea-Soaked Raisin Bread) Recipe
full_text:
Irish Tea Brack (Tea-Soaked Raisin Bread) Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
100 mins
Active
15 mins
Chilling/Cooling Time
8 hrs 15 mins
Total
10 hrs 5 mins
Serves
8 servings
Makes
1 loaf
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1 1/2
cups
raisins
1
cup
strongly brewed tea
, such as
Irish Breakfast
, cooled
2
cups
(about
10
ounces
)
self-rising flour
1
cup
light brown sugar
1/2
teaspoon
cinnamon
1/4
teaspoon
nutmeg
1
large
egg
, lightly beaten
Old-fashioned oats
, thick cut if possible
Directions
Combine raisins and tea in a bowl, cover and refrigerate overnight.
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 350°F. Butter and flour loaf pan, knocking out any excess flour.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, egg, raisins, and tea. Stir to combine and pour into prepared loaf pan. Sprinkle top with oats. Bake bread until top is brown, about 1 hour 40 minutes. Let cool 15 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling.
Special Equipment
8 1/2- by 4 1/2- inch loaf pan
